content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --REPNUM
      operator: exists
    - name: --REPNUM
      operator: is_not_unique_set
      value:
        - USUBJID
        - --TESTCD
        - VISITNUM
        - --VISIT
        - VISITDY
        - TAETORD
        - EPOCH
        - --DTC
        - --STDTC
        - --ENDTC
        - --DY
        - --STDY
        - --ENDY
        - --XDY
        - --XSTDY
        - --XENDY
        - --CHDY
        - --CHSTDY
        - --CHENDY
        - --DUR
        - --TPT
        - --TPTNUM
        - --ELTM
        - --TPTREF
        - --RFTDTC
        - --STRF
        - --ENRF
        - --EVLINT
        - --EVINTX
        - --STRTPT
        - --STTPT
        - --ENRTPT
        - --ENTPT
        - MIDS
        - RELMIDS
        - MIDSDTC
        - --STINT
        - --ENINT
        - --PTFL
        - --PDUR
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0562
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when REPNUM is in the dataset and there are multiple records
  for a subject for a test within the timeframe identified by the timing variables
  on the record, and --REPNUM is null or not unique per subject per test per timing
  variables.
Outcome:
  Message: --REPNUM is null or is not unique per subject per test per timing variables.
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0562
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The instance number of a test that is repeated within
                  a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can
                  vary (e.g., within a time point or within a visit).
                Document: SDTM v2.0
                Item: --REPNUM
                Section: Findings
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when REPNUM is in the dataset and there are multiple records for a subject for a test within the timeframe identified by the timing variables on the record, and --REPNUM is null or not unique per subject per test per timing variables.

Outcome.Message: --REPNUM is null or is not unique per subject per test per timing variables.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point or within a visit).
